class.name: DV_BarChart
class.brief_description: Column and bar chart control with stacking support, hover/click signals, and theme-aware spacing.
class.description:
DV_BarChart renders categorical data as vertical or horizontal bars (depending on [member DVChart.chart/series_axis]). It supports stacked bars, theme-driven colors, and precise hit testing for mouse interaction. Use [method set_gaps] to control inter-category and inter-bar spacing, and listen to [signal bar_clicked] or [signal bar_hovered] to drive tooltips or drill-down behavior.
[codeblocks] [gdscript]
extends DV_BarChart
func _ready() -> void: set_categories(["Desktop", "Tablet", "Mobile"]) add_series("Users", PackedFloat32Array([5204.0, 1510.0, 2490.0])) connect("bar_clicked", _on_bar_clicked) connect("bar_hovered", _on_bar_hovered)
func _on_bar_clicked(series_idx: int, category_idx: int, value: float) -> void: print("Clicked", category_idx, "=", value)
func _on_bar_hovered(series_idx: int, category_idx: int, value: float) -> void: print("Hover", category_idx, "=", value) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]
Details on base class helpers such as [method DVChart.add_series] and [method DVChart.set_categories] can be accessed by following the DVChart reference.

method.name: set_gaps
method.description: Sets the spacing between category bands and individual bars inside each band (in pixels).

members.member: When [code]true[/code], values for each category are stacked rather than grouped side by side.

signal.name: bar_clicked
signal.description: Emitted when a bar is clicked. Provides the series index, category index, and bar value.

signal.name: bar_hovered
signal.description: Emitted when the pointer moves over a bar. Carries the same payload as [signal bar_clicked].
